content.body: zcorpan: I still don't understand the intuition behind this decision. I have read the resources that you pointed out, but still things are vague. There must be some reason to use NodeList for querySelectorAll(), or otherwise it was just a bad design decision...

content.body: The Freelancer: I don't really know, don't recall if HTMLCollection was ever proposed for querySelectorAll. Maybe at the time, HTMLCollection was seen as a HTML-specific thing while qSA can return any element, so NodeList seemed more appropriate

content.body: The Freelancer: if we were to design it today, the return type would probably be `sequence<Element>`
